As a newly minted doctorate in X-ray crystallography, I worked under Robert Fletterick on crystal structures of subtilisin, glycogen phosphorylase, interleukin-4, xylose isomerase, and ecotin. I developed new computational methods for model-free phase refinement.

Experience: Developed a Twitter messages location sampling and distance calculation code for the Australia Crisis Tracker project. In order to satisfy the requirement to process incoming messages at a rate of up to 10k tweets per second, this Java module was designed as a highly parallel multithreaded application for the cluster environment. The running time on a four node multicore cluster was reduced by a factor of 7 as compared to the sequential execution.

Deborah McGuinness is and endowed Chair and Professor of Computer and Cognitive Science. She is also the founding director of the Web Science Research Center at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and the director of the Health Informatics division of the RPI Institute for Data Exploration and Application.  A sampling of current or research projects that Deborah is leading at RPI can be found at http://tw.rpi.edu/web/person/Deborah_L_McGuinness/Projects .

McGuinness Associates is a consulting business that specializes in the Semantic Web, Ontologies, and technologies enabling the next generation of the web and intelligent applications.  One specialty area is in semantic escience applications.
Acting Director and Senior Research Scientist

Deborah was the acting director of the knowledge systems laboratory at Stanford University (see www.ksl.stanford.edu and www.ksl.stanford.edu/people/dlm ).  Deborah's responsibilities included providing technical vision, developing research agendas, obtaining and maintaining funding, advising students, and lab financial responsibility.

Education: As a graduate student, I performed computational linear algebraic research to improve the efficiency of iterative solution strategies by preconditioning the source matrices. My algorithms were targeted towards systems arising from the Finite Element Method. As such they were implemented in parallel and needed to be aware of the data distribution topology in use by the system, they needed to be suitable for both symmetric and asymmetric linear systems, and they needed to minimize the communication burden of the computations.
Experience: Senior Lecturer and Director of the Rensselaer Center for Open Source

Computational mathematics support in the design and development of simulators for surgical procedures and wound analysis. PI on a USAISR supported effort to map burn extent and severity onto morphologically accurate patient avatars. The model based analysis allows for the determination of specific cutaneous functional units impacted by burns as well as an improved calculation of total body area impacted.

Teaching CSCI1100, an introductory computer science course, to a class of 250 students. The course is a fast paced python based exploration of basic computer science concepts beginning with variables and statements and ending with classes and recursion. At the end, the students are expected to be prepared for Data Structures (CSCI1200). Course is co-taught with Professor Chuck Stewart.

Taught Introduction to Computer Science. Responsible for lectures and labs teaching approximately 25 non-majors an introductory course in computer science. Course covered the history of CS and basic hardware and introductory skills in HTML, Java, Excel
OSEHRA (Open Source Electronic Health Record Alliance)

While under contract to OSEHRA I am serving as Director of Open Source Operations overseeing the technical solutions and social aspects of open source community building and maintenance. My specific responsibilities revolve around ensuring that the OSEHRA community has the tools it needs to effectively evaluate the quality of code contributions; certify, perform intake on, and publicize code of sufficiently high quality; and provide tools and forums for continued code evaluation and development. I am specifically interested in automated testing, dashboarding and code coverage utilities.
